Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerÂ I have to say i was a little hesitant to spend the $800 on this baby, but once i got this in my apartment , hooked up and printing , I am convinced I got an awesome deal!My hobby's include cad design, custom automotive projects and my 9-5 job is a maintenance technician, so i have some know how when it comes to design and function as well as failure analysis.This 3d printer has exceeded my expectations and throws all the bad reviews of this product in the trash!This being my first 3d printer and the software that comes with it (matter control), setup was a breeze and fast, i think i spent longer unpacking it then actually setting it up!The first print was a calibration circle, looked and spec'ed out amazing with the supplied filament that comes with the printer.Now there are some mods out that you can print that will improve the quality and the life of the printers electronics, but out of the box this printer has done a wonderful job.It is a little noisy, but what do you expect? its a CNC machine that has motors,belts, and 2 heated surfaces so its gonna make some noise.The only con i really see is Robo3d should have included a10ft power cord and printer com cable, since I'm having a hard time finding a home for this thing.nothing to knock a star off for, but just be aware it has to live next to your computer (duh)A+++ in my book!-Bryan
